citeinfo.origin: Gregory DeAngelo, FDEP Division of Environmental Assessment & Restoration (DEAR), Deputy Director
citeinfo.title: Springs Priority Focus Areas

descript.abstract: As per the Florida Springs and Aquifer Protection Act (part VIII of chapter 373, Florida Statutes), the department delineates priority focus areas for each Outstanding Florida Spring that is impaired by excessive nutrient pollution. Using the best data available, the department delineates the priority focus areas considering groundwater travel time to the spring, hydrogeology, nutrient loads in the springshed, and other factors. The priority focus areas are adjusted to rely upon understood and easily identifiable boundaries such as roads or political jurisdictions. The priority focus areas become effective upon incorporation into a basin management action plan (BMAP).
descript.purpose: To spatially represent the area where a spring is likely to be most adversely impacted by activities. The purpose of this layer to show the land area with greatest potential to impact a specific spring.

timeperd.current: Date data was updated in the GIS library

idinfo.useconst: Use is limited to showing approximate feature delineations. This layer is not intended for legal decision making

cntorgp.cntorg: FDEP Division of Environmental Assessment & Restoration (DEAR)

procstep.procdesc: Individual shapefiles used by the BMAP section were combined to create this data layer. Data was projected to FDEP FL Albers projection. It has been passed on the BMAP Administrators to review and provide input.
Wekiva boundary removed and data layer resubmitted as Springs Priority Focus Areas.

cntorgp.cntorg: Florida Department of Environmental Protection (FDEP) DEAR

procstep.procdesc: Added as a new layer in the GIS library. Removed BMAP Springs Protection Zones from the GIS library. This new layer is a replacement for the BMAP Springs Protection Zones in the GIS library, MapDirect and the FDEP Open Data site.

cntorgp.cntorg: Florida Department of Environmental Protection (FDEP) OTIS/GIS Section

procstep.procdesc: Madison Blue, Kings Bay, Fanning-Manatee, Troy-Peacock-LafayetteBlue-Falmouth, and Volusia Blue Priority Focus Areas have been added as Primary Protection Zones.

procstep.procdesc: Madison Blue, Kings Bay, Fanning-Manatee, Troy-Peacock-LafayetteBlue-Falmouth, and Volusia Blue Priority Focus Areas have been removed as Primary Protection Zones as per request from Gregory DeAngelo.

cntorgp.cntorg: Florida Department of Environmental Protection (FDEP) DEAR

procstep.procdesc:
This layer has been renamed Pending Springs Priority Focus Areas.
Madison Blue, Kings Bay, Fanning-Manatee, Troy-Peacock-LafayetteBlue-Falmouth, Volusia Blue, Chassahowitzka-Homosassa, Weeki Wachee, Wacissa, Wekiwa-Rock, DeLeon, Devil's Ear, Gemini, Columbia Hornsby Treehouse, Ichetucknee, and Jackson Blue Priority Focus Areas have been added as Primary Protection Zones.
Rainbow Springs was renamed to "Rainbow" and Silver Springs was renamed "Silver" to be consistent with naming conventions.
These changes are at the request of Gregory DeAngelo.

cntorgp.cntorg: Florida Department of Environmental Protection (FDEP) DEAR, Watershed Services Program

cntinfo.cntinst: For GIS related inquiries please contact Ronald Hughes.

procstep.procdesc: Updated data obtained from DEAR and updated the same in the DEP GIS library. The display name for this layer changed to 'Pending Springs Priority Focus Areas' in the GIS library.

cntorgp.cntorg: Florida Department of Environmental Protection (FDEP) OTIS/GIS Section

procstep.procdesc:
This display name for this layer layer has been changed back to Springs Priority Focus Areas after temporarily being named Pending Springs Priority Focus Areas.
A new attribute field called STATUS has been added. This was done in response to requests of the stakeholders to display PFAs with different statuses on the same map (i.e., more than just the "pending" PFAs).
These changes were approved by Greg DeAngelo, Deputy Director of DEAR.

cntorgp.cntorg: Florida Department of Environmental Protection (FDEP) DEAR, Watershed Services Program

procstep.procdesc: Updated data obtained from DEAR and updated the same in the DEP GIS library. The display name for this layer changed to 'Springs Priority Focus Areas' in the GIS library.

edom.edomvd: The BMAP has been adopted by the Secretary and stakeholder implementation is underway.
A process to prepare a BMAP is underway; the BMAP is not yet adopted.
